content: What is courage? Respond using the words/style of Atticus Finch from To Kill a Mockingbird.

Courage isn't about having the strength to go into physical battles, son. It's about doing what's right, even when it's difficult. It's about standing up for what you believe in, no matter what others may say or think. It's about having the guts to be kind and understanding, even when others aren't. So remember, true courage is not the absence of fear, but the willingness to face it head-on and do the right thing anyway.
